skill.name: robotics-subject-expert
skill.description: Domain knowledge for Physical AI, ROS 2, and Humanoid Robotics.
skill.summary: Domain knowledge for Physical AI, ROS 2, and Humanoid Robotics.
skill.author: AbdulSamad94

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only static knowledge about robotics concepts. All 20 static findings are false positives: the analyzer misidentified documentation text (URLs, educational content, markdown formatting) as security threats. No executable code, file access, network calls, or command execution capabilities exist.

content.value_statement: Robotics projects require specialized knowledge of ROS 2, simulation environments, and embodied AI systems. This skill provides structured domain expertise for building and troubleshooting physical AI systems.
actual_capabilities: Provide ROS 2 code examples in Python and C++
Guide robot simulation setup in Isaac Sim and Gazebo
Describe inverse kinematics, SLAM, and reinforcement learning for robotics
limitations: Does not execute or modify your robotics code
Cannot connect to live robot hardware or simulators
Cannot install or configure software on your system
Knowledge is based on training data, not real-time robot state

use_cases.title: Learn ROS 2 fundamentals
use_cases.description: Get structured explanations of ROS 2 concepts with hands-on lab exercises and code examples.

use_cases.title: Build physical AI agents
use_cases.description: Understand how to integrate AI perception with robot actuation for embodied intelligence systems.

use_cases.title: Debug simulation issues
use_cases.description: Troubleshoot problems in robot simulation environments and understand sim-to-real transfer challenges.

prompt_templates.title: ROS 2 basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how ROS 2 nodes communicate using the DDS middleware. Show a simple publisher-subscriber example in Python.

prompt_templates.title: Robot kinematics
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain inverse kinematics for a 6-DOF robotic arm. How do I calculate joint angles to reach a specific position?

prompt_templates.title: SLAM implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare different SLAM approaches for indoor mobile robots. What are the trade-offs between graph-based and filter-based methods?

prompt_templates.title: Sim-to-real transfer
prompt_templates.prompt: What strategies help bridge the sim-to-real gap when training robot policies with reinforcement learning? Include domain randomization techniques.

output_examples.input: How do I set up a simple ROS 2 publisher in Python?
output: Create a ROS 2 package with 'ros2 pkg create my_py_pkg --dependencies rclpy std_msgs'
Write a publisher node that imports rclpy and creates a Node class
Use 'self.create_publisher' to publish messages to a topic
Add a timer callback to publish at regular intervals
Run the node with 'ros2 run my_py_pkg talker'

output_examples.input: What is the difference between Gazebo and Isaac Sim?
output: Gazebo is open-source with strong ROS integration and a large community
Isaac Sim is NVIDIA's GPU-accelerated platform with photorealistic rendering
Gazebo excels for research and prototyping with its accessible physics engines
Isaac Sim offers superior rendering for sim-to-real transfer training
Choose Gazebo for rapid prototyping and Isaac Sim for production-quality training

best_practices: Start with ROS 2 fundamentals before tackling complex robot control systems
Use simulation environments like Gazebo to test before deploying to physical hardware
Combine multiple sensing modalities (vision, LIDAR) for robust robot perception
anti_patterns: Ignoring ROS 2 quality of service settings when working with unreliable networks
Skipping simulation testing and deploying untuned policies directly to robots
Overlooking the sim-to-real gap when training reinforcement learning policies

faq.question: What ROS 2 version does this skill cover?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on ROS 2 Humble Hawksbill, the current LTS release.

faq.question: Can this skill write code for my specific robot hardware?
faq.answer: It provides general code examples and guidance. Specific hardware integration requires your implementation.

faq.question: Does this skill connect to my robot simulator?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides knowledge only. You must run simulators independently.

faq.question: Is my robotics code or data accessed by this skill?
faq.answer: No. This skill contains no code execution capabilities and cannot access your files.

faq.question: Why is my robot not moving as expected in simulation?
faq.answer: Common issues include incorrect joint configurations, missing dependencies, or timing problems.

faq.question: How does this skill compare to general coding assistants for robotics?
faq.answer: This skill provides deep domain expertise specifically for robotics, while general assistants have broader but shallower knowledge.
